intro: Jatropha pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's physic nut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a rough texture. Jatropha pringlei is also noted for its toxic properties, as its seeds and other parts contain harmful compounds.
